entries.meaning: Being or pertaining to a particular kind of noncompetition agreement that forbids a former employee from attempting to recruit the employer's colleagues or customers.
The failure to solicit proxies by a company trying to limit expenses incurred from proxy rules.
examples: The parallel study by the New York Curb Exchange indicates an even graver increase in nonsolicitation. A study of nonsolicitation by companies having stock listed on the New York Curb Exchange in the year 1935, prior to the adoption

entries.meaning: A particular kind of noncompetition agreement that forbids a former employee from attempting to recruit the employer's colleagues or customers.
examples: Nonsolicitations are promises to not go after relationships with people. Typically, these prohibit asking employees to leave a company for new opportunities or asking customers to reduce or eliminate purchases with the company.
